body_html:
@yanboliang
Thank you very much for the response.
So basically, there is no need to use model.layers.pop() in this case if I understood the point.
Actually, I think the pop method implementation has changed since I have found many examples where it is used to remove a layer from a model.
You can check:

  1. https://stackoverflow.com/questions/41668813/how-to-add-and-remove-new-layers-in-keras-after-loading-weights
  2. keras-team/keras#8909

@yanboliang

keras-team/keras#8909
body:
@yanboliang 
Thank you very much for the response.
So basically, there is no need to use `model.layers.pop()` in this case if I understood the point.
Actually, I think the `pop` method implementation has changed since I have found many examples where it is used to remove a layer from a model.
You can check:  
1) [https://stackoverflow.com/questions/41668813/how-to-add-and-remove-new-layers-in-keras-after-loading-weights](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/41668813/how-to-add-and-remove-new-layers-in-keras-after-loading-weights)
2) [https://github.com/keras-team/keras/issues/8909](https://github.com/keras-team/keras/issues/8909)
